intro: Centaurea kabirkuhensis, commonly known as Kabir Kuh centaury, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its bright blue or purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
